answers.answer: Yes, I have with 3 of my pregnancies. I could never complete the test without throwing up. After trying several times with the same result i felt it was a waste of my time. I'm careful to watch what I eat and have never had a problem with any of my pregnancies. I know lots of moms on here don't agree with that and think it's important to take the test, but it's your baby and your decision.
I recently took it , it took 3 hours & I got my blood drawn 4 times I wasn't to happy .

I did it and I'm glad I did. I ended up finding out I had gestational diabetes (with my son's pregnancy) . had I not taken the test, I would have continued to "over eat" and my son would have been born with an unhealthy weight. The funny thing is I'm a vegetarian (naturally eating healthy) and still ended up having gestational diabetes.my son was born 8lbs 10oz 20inches long and I'm 5'1. Had I not been watching what I was eating, I couldn't imagine how big he would have been.
I did it and glad I did. I have a lot of pregnancy complications and really wanted to rule it out as an underlying cause.

I had to do it 4 times. I didn't think it was that bad. They made me do it many times because they were convinced I had gestational diabetes due to my daughter measuring so big. End result.. my daughter was big and beautiful 9.4 but never had diabetes.

question: Curious anyone?
title: has anyone decided by choose not to do glucose test?
